settings.title: Copper Compression and Pro Quarterback, Drew Brees, partner together to help people find the Strength To Heal.
settings.text:
In an effort to heighten our mission to make protective performance and personal care solutions available to everyone, Drew will work with us to educate new audiences on the connection between healing the human body with proven, powerful targeted compression.

“With Copper Compression, I'm able to reduce recovery time between practices and game day and the targeted compression helps me get the most out of my performance both on and off the field,” Drew tells us. “It doesn’t matter if you're a professional athlete, or weekend warrior or somebody who goes to work every day - our bodies never take a day off and Copper Compression is for anybody doing anything.”

settings.title: Maximum Copper Advantage
settings.text: We infuse copper directly into the nylon fibers of our high-performance fabric. Then we apply a long-lasting coating of additional copper. This innovative approach provides maximum benefits, extending the life of the product and fighting the source of odor for a superior experience.

settings.title: Four Studies
settings.subtitle: Related studies from The National Institute of Health
settings.block_1_title: Are compression garments effective for the recovery of exercise-induced muscle damage?
settings.block_1_content: “… Analyses of power… and strength… indicate faster recovery of muscle function after exercise.”
settings.block_2_title: Compression recovery effects on exercise-induced muscle damage in young, active females.
settings.block_2_content: “… The results indicate that compression clothing is an effective recovery strategy following exercise-induced muscle damage.”
settings.block_3_title: Effects of compression clothing on performance and recovery
settings.block_3_content: “When compression clothing was applied for recovery purposes after exercise, small to moderate effect sizes were observed in recovery of maximal strength and power, and reductions in muscle swelling and perceived muscle pain; blood lactate removal; and increases in body temperature.”
settings.block_4_title: Metallic Copper as an Antimicrobial Surface
settings.block_4_content: “Bacteria, yeasts, and viruses are rapidly killed on metallic copper surfaces, and the term “contact killing” has been coined for this process.”

settings.text: Father's Day is just around the corner and shopping for dads can be quite the challenge! We want to help make it easier for Dad to do the things he love. Give the gift of relief!

settings.title: The Grill Master
settings.text: “I have carpal tunnel, neuropathy, arthritis, and tendonitis from shoulder to wrist. Started having problems at work holding spatulas or flipping food on the grill. Wore this brace 1 day and saw a tremendous improvement in my comfort and range of motion. No pain all day.”

settings.title: The Coach
settings.text: “This thing works! I wear them when I coach, and sometimes to work (factory job) and my knees feel great. My 11 y/o son noticed a difference in me during soccer practice. I made sure to let him know that I will be even harder to beat now (I'm a defender, he's a midfielder) I cannot explain how/why this knee sleeve works, but it has been absolutely the best thing I've purchased for my achy knees.”

settings.title: The Golfer
settings.text: “I'm 60 years old and play more golf than I deserve. I recently felt elbow pain ( yes, I take lots of strokes). I purchased the device and not only use it when I golf, I use it for exercise and lawn work. I am buying a second one to have as a back up in my golf bag. It works”

settings.title: Travel Junky
settings.text: “Husband wore it every day in Europe, traveling Belgium, Germany, Austria and Italy. He would not have been without it, and with all the backpacking, walking, etc., he was virtually pain-free the entire trip. Awesome!”

settings.title: The Working Dad
settings.text: “I bought these for my dad's foot pain. He works in a factory on his feet all day and has plantar fasciitis. The first day he wore them at work he came home and gave me a hug he was so happy they helped his feet.”

settings.title: For The Fathers In Your Life

settings.text:
Arthritis is a term used to describe inflammation, pain, and stiffness in your joints. There are more than 100 different types of arthritis and related conditions that affect different parts of the body. (1)

Did you know that 23% of adults in the United States have arthritis? That is more than 54 million people! (2) Adults aren't the only people who experience arthritic symptoms. Arthritis can affect people of all ages. According to the Arthritis Foundation, over 300,000 kids and teens have Juvenile Arthritis.(3)

While there is no cure for arthritis, we do want to help relieve some pain so you can continue to do what you love.

settings.title: The Half Finger Glove
settings.text: “I bought these for my mom, who suffers from Osteoarthritis. Her hands hurt all the time, and it disrupts her sleep. She now wears these gloves all day, and at night. Thank you for making such a great product that gives her relief!”

settings.title: The Knee Sleeve
settings.text: “This works great! I have been bothered by arthritis in my knee. I wore this for one night and when I woke up in the morning I could walk without pain. I feel so much better.”

settings.title: Long Sleeve Recovery Shirt
settings.text: “Love your products. I have arthritis and wearing the shirt gives me an added relief so I can reduce my medication!”

Did you know that 23% of adults in the United States have arthritis? That is more that 54 million people! While there is no cure for arthritis, we do want to help relieve some pain so you can continue to do what you love.

settings.pretitle: Learn More about the power of copper
settings.title: Copper : The Odor Killer
settings.block_1_title: Metallic Copper as an Antimicrobial Surface
settings.block_1_content: Bacteria, yeasts, and viruses are rapidly killed on metallic copper surfaces, and the term “contact killing” has been coined for this process. While the phenomenon was already known in ancient times, it is currently receiving renewed attention. This is due to the potential use of copper as an antibacterial material in health care settings. Contact killing was observed to take place at a rate of at least 7 to 8 logs per hour, and no live microorganisms were generally recovered from copper surfaces after prolonged incubation.

settings.title: Plantar fasciitis
settings.text:
(PLAN-tur fas-e-I-tis)

The inflammation of a thick band of tissue that runs across the bottom of each foot and connects the heel bone to the toes.

Plantar fasciitis commonly causes stabbing pain that usually occurs with your first steps in the morning.

settings.block_1_text:
"One night with this on my foot and the next morning, my heel felt normal again for the first time in 3 months."

settings.block_3_text:

- Jeannette M.

settings.pretitle: It All Starts with the Feet
settings.title: Support Your Body's Foundation
settings.text: Becca, mom/fitness trainer/actor, starts her days early. Between all of her responsibilities at home, strenuous sessions at the gym, and spontaneous on call auditions, Becca spends a lot of her time on her feet. With Copper Compression Original Arch Supports, she's able to maneuver through her busy schedule without the stress of everyday foot pain.

settings.section_title: Speed Up Recovery with Copper Compression Foot Relief
settings.text: Healthy feet allow you to travel wherever you want. You use your feet to walk on the street, ride a bike, jog in the parks and climb stairs, among other things. Any discomfort in the toes, heels, arches, and soles is considered foot pain. Wherever the location of your pain is, it can slow you down and harm your life.To get the right treatment, you need to know the exact problem.

settings.title: Target Pain Where It Hurts
settings.block_1_text:

✔️ Reduce muscle strain and redistribute pressure across your feet.

✔️ Sleep through all night with zero discomfort.

✔️ Recommend for flat feet, plantar fasciitis, heel spurs, fibromatosis, and bunions.
settings.block_2_text:
Bunion Corrector Toe Splints

✔️ Fits comfortably into loose fitting shoes.

✔️ A bendable aluminum insert comfortably sits next to your bunion.

✔️ Provide effective yet gentle customized compression on your big toe.

settings.title: Shoulder Pain Relief
settings.text: Reduce the pain with a tried and true method of recovery combining: Rest, Ice, Compression, and Elevation.

A key factor in minimizing shoulder pain and recovery time is to address the injury as soon as possible. After a shoulder injury, you can relieve the swelling and pain and promote healing and flexibility with an easy method of Rest, Ice, Compression, and Elevation. For most people, 3 out of the 4 are readily available at home. Here are our compression recovery solutions designed for shoulder pain.

Most people have experienced back pain at one time or another. Although back pain is a very common issue, many people end up ignoring it, which can lead to more serious health problems.

Back pain usually resolves itself on its own, although it may take a while. Resting properly and taking over-the-counter pain relievers can accelerate recovery. Here we provide some effective compression recovery solutions designed specifically for back pain.

🚨 Muscle aching/ burning/ stabbing

🚨 Pain spread down to the legs

🚨 Inflammation or swelling on the back   

🚨 Tight, stiff feeling especially after laying, sitting, and standing for long periods of time

settings.title: Pain Area: Upper Back
settings.block_1_text: Upper back pain may occur anywhere from the base of your neck to the bottom of your rib cage. It's usually due to soft tissue injuries like strains and sprains, or muscle tension caused by poor posture such as looking downward for a long period.
settings.block_2_text:
☑️ Non-intrusive lightweight figure-8 design

☑️ Retains full range of movement while correcting posture

☑️ Utilize targeted pressure on the back

☑️ Straighten the spine, lightly draw your shoulders back

settings.section_title: Quick and Effective Fixes for Aching Elbows
settings.text: Elbow pain usually results from strained or inflamed soft tissues like tendons, although the pain can self-recover by taking enough rest, it’s still important to address the injury as soon as you can. Ways like applying ice, stretching, and taking medicine can help reduce pain. Here we also provide you with some effective compression recovery solutions designed for elbow pain.

settings.section_title: I Don’t Play Tennis, Will I Possibly Develop a Tennis Elbow?
settings.text:
The answer is...Yes!

Tennis elbow, also called Lateral Epicondylitis, is a most common painful condition that usually happens when tendons in the elbow are overused. Obviously, playing tennis or other racquet sports can cause this injury. Still, some other activities can also put you at risk. 

When your forearm muscles and tendons repeat the same movements over and over, they become damaged from overuse. This results in pain on the outside of the elbow.
